meanings.definition: Having a smooth, shiny, and slightly slippery surface.
meanings.sent1: The new car was waxier than the old one.
meanings.sent2: Her shoes looked waxier after she polished them.
meanings.sent3: The floor was so waxier that I almost slipped!
meanings.sent4: The moonlight made the lake look even waxier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The waxier apples were more appealing to the eye.

meanings.sent1: The wet paint was getting waxier by the minute.
meanings.sent2: As the sun rose, the dew on the grass became waxier.
meanings.sent3: The soap made his hands feel waxier than a candle!
meanings.sent4: Her smile grew waxier as she applied lip gloss.
meanings.sent5: The rain made the road waxier, causing cars to skid.
